instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 01958 PM_SLP_SUS_L unstable
threads.message: It does go to DFU so I tried DFU revive and restore. Board goes to 20V and draws up to about 100 mA but then back to 0. No shorts on the coils. I replaced U7400 as it was getting hot. That is no longer getting hot but Im guessing it's cpu issue if PM_SLP_SUS_L is unstable? Following the power up sequence that is the first rail that appears to be unstable.

threads.title: 01958 PM_SLP_SUS_L unstable
threads.message:
Any history available?
DFU was completed without errors?

L7700 pulses at same time with PM_SLP_SUS_L?

threads.title: 01958 PM_SLP_SUS_L unstable
threads.message:
I got an error once during restore but a couple of times it just goes to the lock like its done so I assume it finished but no boot of course. Yes pulses at L7700 that's how I discovered. 

Board was liquid damage but not bad. worst areas were Q7065 and that seems to be working and U6500. I checked diode readings of Q7401 because it was near some signs and that seems ok.

threads.title: 01958 PM_SLP_SUS_L unstable
threads.message:
No shorts on the coils"
Not always only short is bad.
You should compare values for all power rails with good board, or refference table.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/820-01958[/URL]
Don't forget Power FETs section (page 66).

Also check diode mode for T2 data lines closer to PPBUS_G3H at J6100.
Any liquid sing on audio board?

Did you test the board alone on the desk?
